com.google.gwt.dev.codeserver
Class CompileDir

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.dev.codeserver.CompileDir

public class CompileDir
extends java.lang.Object

Defines a directory tree used for compiling a GWT app one time. Each time we recompile the app, we will create a new, empty CompileDir. This way, a failed compile doesn't modify the last good compile.

The CompileDir gets created within the appropriate AppSpace for the app being compiled.

Method Detail

getRoot

public java.io.File getRoot()
Top-level directory, containing the others.

getWarDir

public java.io.File getWarDir()
The directory tree where the compiler saves output files that should be available via HTTP. It will be in a subdirectory based on the module name, possibly after renaming. Files will be accessible via HTTP until a new compile finishes successfully.

getExtraDir

public java.io.File getExtraDir()
The directory where the compiler saves auxiliary files that shouldn't be available via HTTP.

getGenDir

public java.io.File getGenDir()
The directory tree where the compiler saves source code created by GWT generators. The source is also accessible via HTTP, for use by browser debuggers.

getLogFile

public java.io.File getLogFile()
The file where the GWT compiler writes compile errors and warnings. Also accessible via HTTP.
